 }
diff --git a/.project-roadmap/issues-db/upstream/1028.json b/.project-roadmap/issues-db/upstream/1028.json
index 11dd3fbff..179fce5d4 100644
--- a/.project-roadmap/issues-db/upstream/1028.json

@@ -11,12 +11,19 @@
   "created_at": "2018-07-19T13:18:13Z",
   "github_updated_at": "2026-02-07T16:47:36Z",
   "body_snippet": "<!--- Provide a general summary of the issue in the Title above -->\r\n\r\n## Expected Behavior\r\n\r\nI expect to connect to the machine via RDP without entering credentials.\r\n\r\n## Current Behavior\r\n\r\nFor some machines, when I attempt to connect to an RDP server, I get the message **\"server's authentication policy does not allow connection requests using saved credentials\"**  and I must type in the password to connect.  However, when I use the built-in Windows RDP client, I don't get the same message. ...",
-  "our_status": "new",
-  "priority": null,
+  "our_status": "triaged",
+  "priority": "P2-bug",
   "target_release": null,
   "our_branch": null,
   "our_pr": null,
-  "iterations": [],
+  "iterations": [
+    {
+      "seq": 1,
+      "date": "2026-02-17",
+      "type": "triaged",
+      "description": "Suspected to be an external Windows Group Policy issue (credential delegation) rather than an application bug; awaiting user confirmation."
+    }
+  ],
   "comments": [
     {
       "id": "MDEyOklzc3VlQ29tbWVudDQwNjI4MDE2Nw==",
@@ -42,5 +49,5 @@
   "needs_action": true,
   "waiting_for_us": false,
   "last_synced": "2026-02-15T09:52:50Z",
-  "notes": ""
+  "notes": "AI triage (gemini): Suspected to be an external Windows Group Policy issue (credential delegation) rather than an application bug; awaiting user confirmation.\nApproach: Request feedback on whether GPO settings resolved the issue; close if no response."
 }
diff --git a/.project-roadmap/issues-db/upstream/1031.json b/.project-roadmap/issues-db/upstream/1031.json
index 8ca513507..d047d1ff0 100644
--- a/.project-roadmap/issues-db/upstream/1031.json

   "created_at": "2018-07-21T01:18:12Z",
   "github_updated_at": "2026-02-07T19:54:07Z",
   "body_snippet": "<!--- Provide a general summary of the issue in the Title above -->\r\nWith 1.76 Alpha and imported connections from RDMan, save of ConfCons fails, leaving a zero-byte file behind.  That in turn throws an exception at next mRemoteNG launch.\r\n\r\n## Expected Behavior\r\nConnection file should get saved :-)\r\n\r\n## Current Behavior\r\nError writing ConfCons.xml due to an null value inside, which is not identified.\r\nLog snippet:\r\n\r\n2018-07-11 08:45:38,005 [1] ERROR - SaveToXml failed\r\nValue cannot be null.\r\n...",
-  "our_status": "new",
-  "priority": null,
+  "our_status": "triaged",
+  "priority": "P2-bug",
   "target_release": null,
   "our_branch": null,
   "our_pr": null,
-  "iterations": [],
+  "iterations": [
+    {
+      "seq": 1,
+      "date": "2026-02-17",
+      "type": "triaged",
+      "description": "The issue reports a critical failure (unable to save config) but is dated (v1.77.2) and lacks reproduction steps or logs. Verification on the latest build is required to confirm if it persists."
+    }
+  ],
   "comments": [
     {
       "id": "MDEyOklzc3VlQ29tbWVudDQ1MTg1NzExMw==",
@@ -53,5 +60,5 @@
   "needs_action": true,
   "waiting_for_us": false,
   "last_synced": "2026-02-15T09:52:50Z",
-  "notes": ""
+  "notes": "AI triage (gemini): The issue reports a critical failure (unable to save config) but is dated (v1.77.2) and lacks reproduction steps or logs. Verification on the latest build is required to confirm if it persists.\nApproach: Request detailed logs and reproduction steps on the latest version. If reproducible, investigate XmlConnectionsSaver.cs for file locking, permission handling, or serialization errors."
 }

diff --git a/.project-roadmap/issues-db/upstream/1041.json b/.project-roadmap/issues-db/upstream/1041.json
index b4efc4285..3043de6f8 100644
--- a/.project-roadmap/issues-db/upstream/1041.json
+++ b/.project-roadmap/issues-db/upstream/1041.json
@@ -12,12 +12,19 @@
   "created_at": "2018-07-25T07:17:25Z",
   "github_updated_at": "2026-02-07T19:54:17Z",
   "body_snippet": "Hello.\r\nI did not find such feature, which seems to exist in every other remote connection tool (like Putty, SecureCRT, Superputty). If it is not there, I propose:\r\nAdd to mRemoteNG a feature, allowing to Open a connection via a CMD in a new Tab.\r\n\r\nSyntax could be like this:\r\n`mremoteng --connection \"/connections/interxion/myswitch123\" --newtab`\r\n\r\nAlso you could implement new connection, like this:\r\n`mremoteng  --host myserver.io --port 12345 --protocol ssh2 --username admin --password ADm1n -...",
-  "our_status": "new",
-  "priority": null,
+  "our_status": "triaged",
+  "priority": "P3-enhancement",
   "target_release": null,
   "our_branch": null,
   "our_pr": null,
-  "iterations": [],
+  "iterations": [
+    {
+      "seq": 1,
+      "date": "2026-02-17",
+      "type": "triaged",
+      "description": "The current single-instance logic switches focus to the running instance but fails to pass the command-line arguments (like `--connect`) to it, requiring an IPC mechanism (e.g., Named Pipes) to be added."
+    }
+  ],
   "comments": [
     {
       "id": "MDEyOklzc3VlQ29tbWVudDQ1NTIzMTE2OQ==",
@@ -70,5 +77,5 @@
   "needs_action": true,
   "waiting_for_us": false,
   "last_synced": "2026-02-15T09:52:50Z",
-  "notes": ""
+  "notes": "AI triage (gemini): The current single-instance logic switches focus to the running instance but fails to pass the command-line arguments (like `--connect`) to it, requiring an IPC mechanism (e.g., Named Pipes) to be added.\nApproach: Implement a Named Pipe server in ProgramRoot to listen for arguments from subsequent instances; refactor StartupArgumentsInterpreter to handle runtime requests."
 }
diff --git a/.project-roadmap/issues-db/upstream/1047.json b/.project-roadmap/issues-db/upstream/1047.json

   "github_updated_at": "2026-02-07T19:54:20Z",
   "body_snippet": "I'm on v1.75.7012.16814\r\n\r\nWhen I set a folder to inherit from a folder above it, that has login creds, the sub-folder does not seem to inherit the creds, and connections under the second folder do not seem to inherit the creds from the first folder.\r\n\r\nAny chance we could get this feature added?\r\n\r\nOr, I can't seem to find how this is done, as the normal inheritance method does not seem to do this.",
-  "our_status": "new",
-  "priority": null,
+  "our_status": "triaged",
+  "priority": "P3-enhancement",
   "target_release": null,
   "our_branch": null,
   "our_pr": null,
-  "iterations": [],
+  "iterations": [
+    {
+      "seq": 1,
+      "date": "2026-02-17",
+      "type": "triaged",
+      "description": "The issue is old (v1.77.2) and lacks reproduction steps on current builds; granular inheritance is supported in the codebase (ConnectionInfoInheritance.cs), so specific missing capabilities must be clarified by the user."
+    }
+  ],
   "comments": [
     {
       "id": "MDEyOklzc3VlQ29tbWVudDQwODI5MDUwNg==",
@@ -160,5 +167,5 @@
   "needs_action": true,
   "waiting_for_us": false,
   "last_synced": "2026-02-15T09:52:50Z",
-  "notes": ""
+  "notes": "AI triage (gemini): The issue is old (v1.77.2) and lacks reproduction steps on current builds; granular inheritance is supported in the codebase (ConnectionInfoInheritance.cs), so specific missing capabilities must be clarified by the user.\nApproach: Await user response to confirm if the requested behavior is still missing in the latest version."
 }
diff --git a/.project-roadmap/issues-db/upstream/1049.json b/.project-roadmap/issues-db/upstream/1049.json
index cf5873208..9c991a5ac 100644
--- a/.project-roadmap/issues-db/upstream/1049.json
+++ b/.project-roadmap/issues-db/upstream/1049.json
@@ -10,17 +10,24 @@
   "created_at": "2018-07-27T19:32:00Z",
   "github_updated_at": "2018-07-27T19:32:00Z",
   "body_snippet": "As a developer, I sometimes need extensive debug info to troubleshoot issues that end users are seeing but that I'm not able to replicate. It would be useful to provide a tool within mRemoteNG to gather all debugging information that we may want and allow the user to copy this directly into their bug reports.\r\n\r\n## Expected Behavior\r\nAdd a tool to mRemoteNG under one of the menus that allows the user to view and copy the following information:\r\n- All program settings and their current values\r\n- ...",
-  "our_status": "new",
-  "priority": null,
+  "our_status": "triaged",
+  "priority": "P3-enhancement",
   "target_release": null,
   "our_branch": null,
   "our_pr": null,
-  "iterations": [],
+  "iterations": [
+    {
+      "seq": 1,
+      "date": "2026-02-17",
+      "type": "triaged",
+      "description": "A standalone diagnostic script is needed to collect logs, configuration, and system information from users to aid in troubleshooting issues in the field."
+    }
+  ],
   "comments": [],
   "comments_cursor": "2018-07-27T19:32:00Z",
   "unread_comments": 0,
   "needs_action": false,
   "waiting_for_us": false,
   "last_synced": "2026-02-15T09:52:50Z",
-  "notes": ""
+  "notes": "AI triage (gemini): A standalone diagnostic script is needed to collect logs, configuration, and system information from users to aid in troubleshooting issues in the field.\nApproach: Create a PowerShell script that gathers mRemoteNG logs, configuration files, and system information, and packages them into a zip file for easy sharing."
 }

   "body_snippet": "Hello.\r\nI did not find such feature, which seems to exist in every other remote connection tool (like Putty, SecureCRT, Superputty). If it is not there, I propose:\r\nAdd to mRemoteNG a feature, allowing to Open a connection via a CMD in a new Tab.\r\n\r\nSyntax could be like this:\r\n`mremoteng --connection \"/connections/interxion/myswitch123\" --newtab`\r\n\r\nAlso you could implement new connection, like this:\r\n`mremoteng  --host myserver.io --port 12345 --protocol ssh2 --username admin --password ADm1n -...",

+  "our_status": "triaged",

+      "description": "The current single-instance logic switches focus to the running instance but fails to pass the command-line arguments (like `--connect`) to it, requiring an IPC mechanism (e.g., Named Pipes) to be added."
+    }
+  ],
   "comments": [
     {
       "id": "MDEyOklzc3VlQ29tbWVudDQ1NTIzMTE2OQ==",
@@ -70,5 +77,5 @@

   "last_synced": "2026-02-15T09:52:50Z",
-  "notes": ""
+  "notes": "AI triage (gemini): The current single-instance logic switches focus to the running instance but fails to pass the command-line arguments (like `--connect`) to it, requiring an IPC mechanism (e.g., Named Pipes) to be added.\nApproach: Implement a Named Pipe server in ProgramRoot to listen for arguments from subsequent instances; refactor StartupArgumentsInterpreter to handle runtime requests."
 }

   "body_snippet": "I'm on v1.75.7012.16814\r\n\r\nWhen I set a folder to inherit from a folder above it, that has login creds, the sub-folder does not seem to inherit the creds, and connections under the second folder do not seem to inherit the creds from the first folder.\r\n\r\nAny chance we could get this feature added?\r\n\r\nOr, I can't seem to find how this is done, as the normal inheritance method does not seem to do this.",

   "github_updated_at": "2018-07-27T19:32:00Z",
   "body_snippet": "As a developer, I sometimes need extensive debug info to troubleshoot issues that end users are seeing but that I'm not able to replicate. It would be useful to provide a tool within mRemoteNG to gather all debugging information that we may want and allow the user to copy this directly into their bug reports.\r\n\r\n## Expected Behavior\r\nAdd a tool to mRemoteNG under one of the menus that allows the user to view and copy the following information:\r\n- All program settings and their current values\r\n- ...",

+      "date": "2026-02-17",
+      "type": "triaged",
+      "description": "A standalone diagnostic script is needed to collect logs, configuration, and system information from users to aid in troubleshooting issues in the field."
+    }
+  ],
   "comments": [],
   "comments_cursor": "2018-07-27T19:32:00Z",
   "unread_comments": 0,
   "needs_action": false,
   "waiting_for_us": false,
   "last_synced": "2026-02-15T09:52:50Z",
-  "notes": ""
+  "notes": "AI triage (gemini): A standalone diagnostic script is needed to collect logs, configuration, and system information from users to aid in troubleshooting issues in the field.\nApproach: Create a PowerShell script that gathers mRemoteNG logs, configuration files, and system information, and packages them into a zip file for easy sharing."
 }
